name: 3-Nitrostilbene
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3833
Reason: 3-Nitrostilbene has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The stilbene ring introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +20°C. The presence of two phenyl groups can also contribute to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at approximately +20°C each, totaling +40°C.
